content: In the following questions, I will provide a target Python program code. The code is a program containing a loop, and the purpose of the code is indicated by its function name. Please provide a loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop to prove the partial correctness of the program. The loop invariant should be written in the form 'xxx_value = fun(arr[xxx]->arr[xxx])'. (Please note that your answer should only contain statements in the specified format without any additional text.)(Notice that for the same program, if the loop is changed to iterate from the end to the beginning, the array index in the loop invariant should be adjusted to the latter part.)

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided program is:


```less
max_value_i = find_max(arr[start_i:end_i])
```
where `start_i` and `end_i` are the indices of the current iteration.

The loop invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is always the maximum value in the current iteration of the loop. It also ensures that the loop terminates when it reaches the end of the array.

Please note that this invariant assumes that the provided program correctly implements the `find_max` function, which should return the maximum value in the array. If you have any doubts about the correctness of the provided program, please provide more information or clarify any further details you may have.

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided program is:

`max_value_i = find_max(arr[i:])`

This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is always the maximum value in the current iteration of the loop. It also ensures that the loop terminates when it reaches the beginning of the array.

The program assumes that `arr` is a list or array and that `find_max` is a function that takes an array or list and returns its maximum value. If you have any doubts about the correctness of the provided program, please provide more information or clarify any further details you may have.
